meanings.definition: A person or thing that suppresses or extinguishes something.
meanings.sent1: The firefighter was a queller of the flames, putting out the fire swiftly.
meanings.sent2: The queller of the noise was the thick curtains that blocked the sound from outside.
meanings.sent3: The queller of fun at the party was the unexpected power outage, dimming the mood.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor acted as a queller of tensions in the room, soothing everyone.
meanings.sent5: The queller of hunger for the birds was the plentiful seeds in the feeder.

meanings.sent1: She tried to queller her fears by taking deep breaths and focusing on the present.
meanings.sent2: The rain helped to queller the flames that threatened to spread across the field.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to queller his laughter during the serious meeting, but a snort escaped.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's stern look quellered any further disruptions in the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The soothing music helped to queller the anxiety that had been building up all day.
